page.title: 20LOCAL CUSTOMS_CLEE HILL AREA
page.content:
Outside the grave_yard of{St. {John's Church, Hope Bagot,}there is a{ {small water spout.}There is a little goblet on a chain, from which travellers can quench their thirst. It is called{St. Peter's Spout.} Inside the church_yard, there is a{well.}If your eyes are tired and weak, you can bathe them in the water, and it is supposed to heal them. There is a tale that if you run round{St. Peter's Church, Clee Hill,}3 times, at midnight, then knock on the door, a spirit is supposed to come out and snatch you in.
This area has been studied by 4th. year children, (with the help of 2nd. and 3rd. year children), from{CLEE {HILL COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL. }
